flawed_nl_solution:
Earl will have $90 - $28 = $<<90-28=62>>62 after paying off his debt to Fred.
Fred will have $48 + $28 = $<<48+28=76>>76 after being paid by Earl.
But then Fred will have $76 - $32 = $<<76-32=44>>44 after paying Greg.
Greg will have $36 + $32 = $<<36+32=71>>71 after Fred paid him.
Then, Greg will have $71 - $40 = $<<71-40=31>>31 after paying off his debt to Earl.
Then, Earl will then have $62 + $40 = $<<62+40=102>>102.
So together, Greg and Earl will have $31 + $102 = $<<31+102=133>>133.
#### 133

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 68, not 71. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
